docs.abstract: I’m always being prescribed medicine, but I never thought I’d get a prescription for a puppy.
docs.snippet: I’m always being prescribed medicine, but I never thought I’d get a prescription for a puppy.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama and Mitt Romney have very different ideas on reducing the budget deficit, but experts have doubts that either plan is up to the challenge.

headline.seo: Obama Faces Test as Deficit Stays Above $1 Trillion
headline.main: Test for Obama as Deficit Stays Over $1 Trillion
headline.print_headline: Test for Obama As Deficit Stays Over $1 Trillion

docs.abstract: President Obama and Mitt Romney have very different ideas on reducing the budget deficit, but experts have doubts that either plan is up to the challenge; deficit for the fiscal year 2012, despite small annual improvements, will surpass $1 trillion for the fourth straight time; fiscal imbalance on Obama's watch has saddled him with one of his biggest vulnerabilities.
docs.snippet: President Obama and Mitt Romney have very different ideas on reducing the budget deficit, but experts have doubts that either plan is up to the challenge.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers have been studying the Tsimane, the largest indigenous group in the Amazon still living in traditional ways, to tease out insights into diseases ailing modernized societies.

headline.seo: In the Bolivian Amazon, a Yardstick for Modern Health
headline.main: In Bolivian Amazon, a Yardstick for Modern Health
headline.print_headline: In Bolivian Amazon, a Yardstick for Modern Health

docs.abstract: Dozens of researchers participating in the Tsimane Health and Life History Project have been studying Bolivia's large indigenous Tsimane group since 2002, hoping to tease out insights into the medical conditions that plague modernized societies.
docs.snippet: Researchers have been studying the Tsimane, the largest indigenous group in the Amazon still living in traditional ways, to tease out insights into diseases ailing modernized societies.

docs.lead_paragraph: Not long ago, there were smart people who doubted that such a thing as a post-Fidel Cuba could even exist. What comes after the Castros is as much of a mystery as ever.
docs.abstract: John Jeremiah Sullivan article describes visiting Cuba now that Fidel Castro has largely ceded his public role to his brother Raul, while still retaining much of his power; notes what comes after the Castros is as much of a mystery as ever.
docs.snippet: Not long ago, there were smart people who doubted that such a thing as a post-Fidel Cuba could even exist. What comes after the Castros is as much of a mystery as ever.
